snippet: Last month, nearly 40,000 flights were canceled in the United States, about four times the previous two January totals, according to FlightAware, and more snow and ice is forecast this week in the South and Northeast.
abstract: FlightAware reports that nearly 40,000 flights were canceled in the United States in January 2014 due to winter storms, about four times the previous two January totals; regional snowstorm can have nationwide implications, causing havoc for fliers out on business.
lead_paragraph: Last month, nearly 40,000 flights were canceled in the United States, about four times the previous two January totals, according to FlightAware, and more snow and ice is forecast this week in the South and Northeast.

headline.main: Winter Storms Cause Havoc for Fliers
